definition: lit. fish bone of a minister (idiom); fig. person one can rely on for candid criticism
to choke on a piece of food/(literary) a fish bone lodged in one's throat
to choke on a piece of food
state official or subject in dynastic China/I, your servant (used in addressing the sovereign)/Kangxi radical 131
Ma Fuzi (-260 BC), hapless general of Zhao 趙國|赵国, who famously led an army of 400,000 to total annihilation at battle of Changping 長平之戰|长平之战 in 260 BC/also called Zhao Kuo 趙括|赵括
magnanimous on the outside, but hateful on the inside (idiom)
the most senior minister of many kingdoms or dynasties (with varying roles)/prime minister
official who dares speak frankly before the emperor
high merit that one can never repay (idiom); invaluable achievements
to sit and await success or failure (idiom); to wait to see the outcome of a fight before taking sides/to sit on the fence
Xiao He (-193 BC), famous strategist and chancellor, fought on Liu Bang's 劉邦|刘邦[Liu2 Bang1] side during the Chu-Han Contention 楚漢戰爭|楚汉战争[Chu3 Han4 Zhan4 zheng1]
